If women really were more intuitive, they'd teach their sons to be more intuitive

You're not getting it. Women's brains are genetically hardwired to be more intuitive.

The male brain is less integrated and holistic than a female brain. The male brain is more autistic and left-hemisphere dominant while the female brain is more balanced, giving her access to more intuitive capacity of the right-hemisphere.

Of course there are exceptions. I'm speaking generally.

This is one of reasons why witches are classically women. Women are not only more intuitive, they often have psychic abilities which is why women are more interested in stuff like astrology and psychic stuff. Of course not all women have psychic abilities, but I think a larger percentage of them do than men.

This is not about teaching it to their sons.

item.title: This Is Why Men Have Less SΕX Than Women
item.description:
in Dating, Relationships, Sexuality

To be more helpful to you, women generally have less problems with being incels simply because women are more social creatures. These days it's all too easy for a man to lock himself in his mancave and spend most of his time online or playing video games. You just can't get laid that way. If you invested as much time into being social as you did into playing video games or hanging around online, you'd get laid way more.

The #1 biggest thing you can do to increase your sex is to be social.

It's that simple. But it requires you make structural changes to your way of life. Which of course no one wants to do.

Try it. Make a goal to talk to 10 new people every day for 90 days. You'll be amazed at the opportunities that come your way. Not just sex but jobs, ideas, friendships, etc. Being social takes effort for many people, especially guys and introverts.

If you're an introverted guy who spends all his time online, you will basically never get laid. So change that.

item.title: Higher states of consciousness
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Tesla had extraordinary visualization abilities.

Tesla seemed like an abnormally conscious individual just by default. He was probably in a higher state of consciousness than most humans on a regular basis, even without special techniques.

If you just go into solitude for days at a time without distraction, you can become very creative. No special techniques necessary. But you could also practice visualization techniques and train your focus. I get most creative on my solo meditation retreats. Tesla was very solitary and focused, so you might say he spent most of his life in a solo retreat.

And of course there's psychedelics. Nothing will super-charge your mind like a psychedelic.

You manifest faster at higher consciousness because the limits of material reality literally melt away -- since "physical reality" is nothing more than a state of consciousness.

But in general don't think that you can emulate Tesla. He was a unique genius. You ain't him. Focus on being more you.

item.title: System for watched videos
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

You can download videos and sort them into two folders, New and Watched.

There are probably also plugins for your web browser that let you add notes to a URL.

Or you could even bookmark every watched video into its own Watched folder.

You will need to watch my videos many times over to grasp them. If only it was as easy as watching them once.

item.title: If your greatest concern is election integrity
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

What's not appreciated is that elections are messy. They never get 100% of the vote accurate. There is always some margin of error. This is compounded in caucauses because they are so messy and people-centered. This is not a computer chip lab. This is ordinary people behaving like herd animals. Yes, stuff will go wrong. Flipping a coin properly is not as easy as it seems if you've never done it before. You can flip a coin, it flys out of your hand, rolls on the floor, gets lodged sideways in a crack, and then what do you do??

That is not rigging. That's just the system we got.

Improvements to the system are also not easy to make. People yell about how flipping coins is so old fashioned and outdated, yet when they upgrade the system to be electronic and use apps, even more stuff goes wrong.

You can't please someone who sits on a couch and righteously demands perfection.

Go try to run a local election. See how challenging it is organize. See how many mistakes you make.

Go try to build an app without bugs. See how far you get.

It's easy to bitch about stuff when you have zero experience building it. Building complex systems is always far more challenging than it seems.

item.title: What does Christ on the Cross represent? Is it a collective shadow?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
54 minutes ago, Esoteric said:

I've thought about this quite a bit the last month. And of course there is many layers to the symbolism of Christ and the crucifiction. But for me it represents the people and environment around "you". You let the environment and the people in your presence kill you. You interract with the world and it will destroy your sense of self. This can come of as so incredibly vicious and cruel at times that you start questioning how God can do this to you. You feel abandoned and violated but you still in your last ounce of faith trust the process and reality. Then you die. Then the resurrection happens.

So, ignorance and Love?

item.title: Trump & Netanyahu On The New Israeli-Palestinian Deal
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
53 minutes ago, Nivsch said:

Even if he has murdered people?

This kind of videos make murders appear like an innocent victims of "Israel devilery" and mislead the world by lies.

First of all, you have no idea if he actually murdered people. It's easy to smear innocent people as "terrorists" with no trial or proof. The USA labels innocent people are "terrorists" all the time. It's all too convenient.

Secondly, even if he murdered people, he is still human and he is still God.

Matthew 5:43-48 The Sermon on the Mount: Love for Enemies:

Quote

"You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor’ and ‘Hate your enemy.’ But I say to you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you, in order that you may be sons of your Father who is in heaven, because he causes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and he sends rain on the just and the unjust. For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Do not the tax collectors also do the same? And if you greet only your brothers, what are you doing that is remarkable? Do not the Gentiles also do the same? Therefore you be perfect as your heavenly Father is perfect."

This is what Jesus taught. Because Love is the highest truth.

item.title: Example Of Going Against One's Team
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

This is a great example of challenging herd mentality and ideology. Imagine how challenging this was for his mind to do.

It's great to see a handful of conservatives with integrity and courage.

It's important to remember that there ARE decent conservatives out there. They aren't all MAGA.

It's problematic to hold the stereotype that all conservatives are bad or irredeemable. Always remember that there is no such thing as "a conservative". There is diversity within such broad categories.

One of the dangers of the Trump phenomenon is that many decent conservatives are not given a voice. After Trump is gone it's important that there be a rebuilding of the conservative party into something with more integrity, because roughly half the country leans conservative and you will never get them to all become liberals. So either there will be a healthy expression of conservativism or an unhealthy one.

It is in the best interest of Bernie supporters to understand this and support healthy expressions of conservativism. Because the alternative would be worse.

engage in what SHOULD be a connecting experience for 20 something minutes, then tell her to get out of my house and be done with her.

No one is forcing you to do one night stands.

And also understand that many women are into one night stands. Women who go to a nightclub are interested in sex. They are not there to play pattycakes.

I met two gals who flew into Vegas with the desire to have sex with new guys every day of the week while they were here. After I slept with one of them, she didn't even want to see me the next day. She went looking for a new guy.

Women are not such innocent creatures.

And not all sex requires some deep commitment. I've had sex with women and then we both happily go our separate ways with no hard feelings.

item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
1 hour ago, traveler said:

The absolute is merely hiding from itself in an illusion of seperateness. This is the absolute. If the absolute is the absolute how can it ever not be fully the absolute? How can there be a "you" that has the possibility of becoming the absolute, that isn't that already? Wouldn't that suggest that the absolute isn't absolute? The idea of becoming the absolute is just another story/illusion.  

Everything is the Absolute but there are many levels of being conscious of what the Absolute is.

An ant is the Absolute but has very little consciousness of that fact due to its incarnation in that finite body. So the body one inhabits matters.

item.title: Realizing absolute perfection
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Yes, addition and subtraction are not possible from the Absolute perspective.

Moreover, there is no difference what you add or subtract because without self-bias it doesn't matter what is added or subtracted or neither since everything has equal value.

What meaning can adding or subtracting money to your bank account have if a positive balance has equal value to a negative balance in your mind?

Value itself is a product of self-bias.

What is the value of the whole Universe?

item.title: What are some ways to deal with anger?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

As soon as you feel anger, get directly underneath it by asking the question, "How have I been hurt here?"

The anger is a false mask for hurt. Become conscious of the hurt and sit with it. Allow yourself to feel hurt.

The crucial mistake is trying to be invulnerable. Be vulnerable. That is what's true. All finite forms are vulnerable.

item.title: Why is there something rather than nothing line of questions and contemplation.
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Reality is not made out of particles. It is groundless. You cannot ground it in anything because any ground would be itself.

Again, Oneness.

There is only one miracle: Oneness

item.title: I'M SPEECHLESS - 1P-LSD - Super SMALL dose - HUGE SHOCKING INSIGHT
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
7 hours ago, Red-White-Light said:

@Leo Gura I don't understand these weird experiences isn't it better to avoid them best you can and focus on Actuality instead?

Those weird experiences open your rigid mind. Which is crucial in this work.

How can you hope to master consciousness when you don't even want to explore it?

item.title: Why is there something rather than nothing line of questions and contemplation.

in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
3 hours ago, mandyjw said:

Why the back and forth?

What would constrain it?

Can't you see that if a thing is ONE, it can have no constraints.

Quote

Why the good and bad?

No bad, only Good. Bad is your mind judging.

item.title: Jordan peterson on enlightenment
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
14 minutes ago, tsuki said:

You mean, like, zero? Not a single peak of all the enlightenment mountains?
Maybe there is an enlightenment peak that is accessed through psychology?

He had some tiny mystical experience but that doesn't mean he understands enlightenment proper.

Quote

Yes, I agree. But don't you do that as well?
All teachings are partial and lead straight to hell because if they aim at any audience, then they are based on objective meaning.
If you don't admit the possibility that some hells are less contracted than others, then what is the point of teaching at all?

I have a much better understanding of the traps of this work and communicate that. Of course that still doesn't make the process fool-proof. But my teachings are far more advanced and accurate than JP's. Again, not that my teachings are necessarily perfect.

Yes, all teachings are relative, but some are better than others. Especially if we're talking about advanced topics like overcoming suffering or understanding God. Very few people understand such topics accurately.

Quote


I think that given how large Peterson's audience is, the hell he's leading into is not all that bad.

A large audience compounds the danger of ignorance and ideology.

If JP had a small audience I'd be much less hard on him.

Quote

PS. I do understand why you're calling people devils, but as a technical term - demons would be more appropriate.

Demons demonize, but devils? Hmmm...

Devil is a technical term in my lexicon.

Demon means something else to me. To me a demon is an actual demon-looking entity. A non-human.

Devil is the right term because it implies deception and trickery. Which is what we're mostly dealing with in this work. Devil is also the opposite of God, which is exactly what the ego is. It's a very powerful term once you get a handle on it.

item.title: Conscious Politics or Just Social Democracy
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

@Dylan Page And I'm saying you're taking it for granted.

It's like you have a favorite dog and you're asking us to tell you why you should feed it rather than letting it starve to death.

In this era of Trump and nationalist movements all over the world you still haven't learned how fragile democracy is???

You are definitely asking for a whipping.

item.title: I'M SPEECHLESS - 1P-LSD - Super SMALL dose - HUGE SHOCKING INSIGHT
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
8 hours ago, Serotoninluv said:

Last year I took a trip with a gal who is an intermediate-level Reiki student. We went to an energy vortex in Sedona, AZ. She was vibrating even before we dosed.  . . .  During the trip she met some type of spirit guide and went to another realm. When she returned, she started crying and said "I can do it myself now. I no longer need anyone else to do it". She advanced a full Reiki level that day. Literally. When she returned, she was immediately advanced a full level. She was able to move energy on her own.

in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

@Derek White @Leo Gura I really struggle to understand the reasoning behind even getting up to go vote.

Lol

You should go spend a few months in North Korea.

Nothing helps the mind understand a thing like some old fashioned tyranny.

You don't know what you got until you've lost it.

in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

You are a devil trying to redeem himself before God. Seems like you like the light. Come closer little devil, if you dare. It will sting, but only until you are dead.

item.title: Jordan peterson on enlightenment
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Peterson has no clue what enlightenment is. Nor is he Spirally aware.

Attachment to meaning is the source of all suffering. So he is unwittingly leading people straight to hell, along with him. That's what ignorance does. The pursuit of falsehood (objective meaning) is devilry.

If you want to understand suffering, Buddhism explains it perfectly. The solution to suffering is perfectly clear. Yet no one wants to do it. People love to beat around the bush.

item.title: Empathy, Compassion, Unity
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Learning to living more and more selflessly is the whole point of life.

The more selflessly you live, the more profound and rewarding your life will be, until one day your selflessness reaches an infinite degree, you become God, and your life is complete.

The only thing holding you back is fear.

Do not let people bully you into thinking that the pursuit of God is somehow selfish. It's just the opposite, and your only path to salvation. If you lose touch with your desire to be selfless, your whole life is lost. You have sold your soul to the devil. Of course devils will try to convince you that being selfless or pursuing God is selfish.

item.title: Are there things better than final awakening or enlightenment?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Llight Your desire to control and dominate emotions and experience miracles is precisely ego-mind.

You have no clue what awakening means yet and how astonishing it is. If you got a taste of it, you'd throw everything else in the trash.

item.title: Conscious Politics or Just Social Democracy
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
47 minutes ago, Dylan Page said:

@Leo Gura Why do you value voting? I see it as a waste of time. My vote is droplet in the sea of others. My impact is effectively 0.

I have explained this in the past.

Without voting, you will have tyranny. Do you value being enslaved? Are you so lazy and cynical that you would rather be enslaved than spend 1 hour every 2 years voting?

item.title: "Through the looking glass" blog post
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

You can define all you want, but it will mean nothing until you go through the looking glass yourself.

Talking about what's through the looking glass is not the same thing as being through the looking glass.

Talk is cheap, and direct experience is not a philosophy. It's what is.

The possibilities of consciousness cannot be described in words.

item.title: I've been having multiple awakenings over the past two weeks! (questions welcome)
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@TheHealer Good.

And are you aware that you are God and that you created all this?

Why did you create it?

item.title: I've been having multiple awakenings over the past two weeks! (questions welcome)
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@TheHealer Great!

So what exactly did you become conscious of?

Do you understand what God is? What Love is? Why existence is?

I don't doubt you had some awakenings, but just trying to ascertain how deep they went and what may be left to realize. Many juicy facets of this thing.
